Package com.ccprog3.myfarm.model

Class Ground

java.lang.Object
com.ccprog3.myfarm.model.Ground
public class Ground extends Object
A class that deals with soil tile, plant tile, rock tile, etc.
Author:
Dan

  • Constructor Details

    • Ground

      public Ground(int row, int column)
      The constructor. Takes the grid's position.
      Parameters:
      row - - the ground's row position in the game grid
      column - - the ground's column position in the game grid

  • Method Details

    • removeCrop

      public boolean removeCrop()
      Removes the crop regardless the tool used. It only sets the seed to null if the ground is holding a seed, otherwise it returns false for unsuccessful removal. It only checks for the presence of the seed, so it does not care if the ground has a rock.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the ground has a crop, withered or not. Only returns false if the ground already does not have anything.

    • plowMe

      public boolean plowMe()
      Plow the ground. Returns the Boolean status for error checking.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the ground is successfully plowed. It only returns false when the player attempts to plow on the already plowed ground.

    • plant

      public boolean plant(Crop seed)
      Plants the seed. Just setting the seed field with the new seed in the parameter.
      Parameters:
      seed - The new seed with given data (e.g. name, type, lifetime, bonuses)
      Returns:
      Returns true after successfully plants the seed. It will return false otherwise when the ground has a seed already.

    • spawnRock

      public boolean spawnRock()
      Spawns a single rock on the ground. Sets the hasRock to true. This ground only accepts actions with a pickaxe. This function won't run if there is a seed there, withered or not.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the rock is successfully spawned. If it has a seed, it returns false otherwise.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears both seed and rocks. Also clears the plowed status.

    • destroyRock

      public boolean destroyRock()
      Destroys the rock of the selected ground. Simply sets the hasRock Boolean to false.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the rock is successfully destroyed. It only returns false otherwise if it does not have a rock in the first place.

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Gets the row position on the grid. One of the getters for gathering information about the grid positioning.
      Returns:
      Returns a non-negative integer.

    • getColumn

      public int getColumn()
      Gets the column position on the grid. One of the getters for gathering information about the grid positioning.
      Returns:
      Returns a non-negative integer.

    • getSeed

      public Crop getSeed()
      Returns a seed object that the ground currently holds. A getter method that returns the seed field.
      Returns:
      Returns either a seed object or null.

    • getHasRock

      public boolean getHasRock()
      Returns a Boolean value whether the ground has a rock or not. A getter of the rock presence field.
      Returns:
      Returns true if it has a rock. Returns false otherwise.

    • isPlowed

      public boolean isPlowed()
      Returns a Boolean value that indicates the ground's plow status. Useful to determine if the player can plant crops on that ground.
      Returns:
      Returns true if it is already plowed. Returns false otherwise.

    • turnToUnPlowed

      public boolean turnToUnPlowed()
      Removes the plowed status of the ground.
      Returns:
      Returns true if it successfully unplowed.
